operations.summary: Returns a list of all Alert Handler objects

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SCIM filter

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Specifies a property value by which to sort

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Specifies either ascending or descending alphabetical order

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to return

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Indicates the number of results per page

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to include in the response

parameters.name: excludeAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to exclude from the response

responseMessages.message: The requested operation succeeded
The requested operation succeeded and no further information has been provided, such as in the case of a DELETE operation.
The request contents are incorrectly formatted or the request was made for an invalid API version.
The requester cannot be authenticated
The requester does not have the required privileges or another constraint failed, such as attempting to delete an edit-only object.
The requested path does not refer to an existing object or object relation.

The requested operation could not be performed due to the current state of the configuration. For example, an attempt was made to create an object that already exists or an attempt was made to delete an object that is referred to by another object.
The request is such that the Accept header does not indicate that JSON is an acceptable format for a response.
The server encountered an unexpected error.

operations.summary: Add a new Alert Handler to the config

parameters.description: Alert Handler to add
parameters.name: add-alert-handler-request
attributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to include in the response

parameters.name: excludeAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to exclude from the response

parameters.name: applyChangeTo
parameters.description: Specify whether to apply this configuration change to a single server or the whole server group. This does not apply to mirrored subtree objects

handlerName.description: Name of the new Alert Handler

outputLocation.description: The location to which alert messages will be written.

enabledAlertSeverity.description: Specifies the alert severities for which this alert handler should be used. If no values are provided, then this alert handler will be enabled for alerts with any severity.

extensionClass.description: The fully-qualified name of the Java class providing the logic for the Third Party Alert Handler.

senderAddress.description: Specifies the email address to use as the sender for messages generated by this alert handler.

senderPhoneNumber.description: The outgoing phone number to use for the messages. Values must be phone numbers you have obtained for use with your Twilio account.

twilioAccountSID.description: The unique identifier assigned to the Twilio account that will be used.

twilioAuthToken.description: The auth token for the Twilio account that will be used.

longMessageBehavior.description: The behavior to use for alert messages that are longer than the 160-character size limit for SMS messages.

description.description: A description for this Alert Handler

serverPort.description: Specifies the port number of the SNMP agent to which traps will be sent.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the Alert Handler is enabled.

extensionArgument.description: The set of arguments used to customize the behavior for the Third Party Alert Handler. Each configuration property should be given in the form 'name=value'.

disabledAlertType.description: Specifies the names of the alert types that are disabled for this alert handler.

includeMonitorDataFilter.description: Include monitor entries that match this filter.

serverHostName.description: Specifies the address of the SNMP agent to which traps will be sent.

asynchronous.description: Indicates whether the server should attempt to invoke this Alert Handler in a background thread so that any potentially-expensive processing (e.g., performing network communication to deliver the alert notification) will not delay whatever processing the server was performing when the alert was generated.

communityName.description: Specifies the name of the community to which the traps will be sent.

scriptArgument.description: The set of arguments used to customize the behavior for the Scripted Alert Handler. Each configuration property should be given in the form 'name=value'.

recipientAddress.description: Specifies an email address to which the messages should be sent.

outputFormat.description: The format to use when writing the alert messages.

enabledAlertType.description: Specifies the names of the alert types that are enabled for this alert handler.

twilioAuthTokenPassphraseProvider.description: The passphrase provider that may be used to obtain the auth token for the Twilio account that will be used.

messageBody.description: Specifies the body that should be used for email messages generated by this alert handler.

messageSubject.description: Specifies the subject that should be used for email messages generated by this alert handler.

scriptClass.description: The fully-qualified name of the Groovy class providing the logic for the Groovy Scripted Alert Handler.

command.description: Specifies the path of the command to execute, without any arguments. It must be an absolute path for reasons of security and reliability.

recipientPhoneNumber.description: The phone number to which alert notifications should be delivered.

httpProxyExternalServer.description: A reference to an HTTP proxy server that should be used for requests sent to the Twilio service.

outputLocation.description: The location to which alert messages will be written.
